result.execSummary:
The defendant Braden D Mann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $500.00 fine plus costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
------------------------------
Restitution is set at $3,522.65, joint and several with co-actors, subject to defendant's right to challenge within 60 days.  Restitution is held open 60 days.

Pay cost of HIV test in the amount of $161.03.
------------------------------

No contact, direct or indirect, with victim or her family other than in legal proceedings. Not to possess or consume alcohol Not to possess any controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. Provide DNA Sample and pay surcharge. Any prescription medications to be made known to the Agent and taken as prescribed.
------------------------------
Defendant to submit to appropriate test for herpes. State to file order with attachment and defense will have 60 days to review order and provide response. 
------------------------------
Defendant may use Internet for purposes of school. Court finds the defendant is EXEMPT From registering as a sex offender. This exemption was used under Statute 301.45.

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence on or before May 9, 2015 @ 8:00 am. The Defendant is to serve nine (9) months of the conditional release jail time. The remaining three (3) months are STAYED for Agent's use.

to Adjourn Jury Trial - Granted on 9-30-14

Defendant Braden D Mann in court with attorney Michael J Fitzgerald.  Estee E Scholtz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 1, 2, 3 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Braden D Mann in court with attorney Michael J Fitzgerald.  Estee E Scholtz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Bond remains.  Status conference scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 08:15 am.

IT IS ORDERED THAT:
1) The defendant may have contact with Gage Timmer for the purpose of visiting their grandfather, Richard Mann
2) Such contact shall be in the presence of an adult member of the Mann or Timmer families.
3) At no time during such contact may Braden Mann and Gage Timmer discuss the court case.

Defendant Braden D Mann in court with attorney Michael J Fitzgerald.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 08:15 am.

records.addlTxt:
**AMENDMENT 05-06-2014: PURSUANT TO STIPULATION AND ORDER SIGNED BY THE PARTIES, IT IS ORDERED THAT:
1) The defendant may have contact with Gage Timmer for the purpose of visiting their grandfather, Richard Mann
2) Such contact shall be in the presence of an adult member of the Mann or Timmer families.
3) At no time during such contact may Braden Mann and Gage Timmer discuss the court case.

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH E.A.D. (DOB 2-2-1999) NO CONTACT WITH CO-ACTORS GAGE TIMMER OR NICHOLAS COOK.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Braden D Mann in court with attorney Michael J Fitzgerald.  Daniel A Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed. Preliminary hearing requested.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
